org.foxlabs.validation.converter

Class MapConverter<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.foxlabs.validation.AbstractValidation<V>
      • org.foxlabs.validation.converter.SequenceConverter<Map<K,V>>
        • org.foxlabs.validation.converter.MapConverter<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of map keys
    V - The type of map values
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter<Map<K,V>>, Validation<Map<K,V>>

    public final class MapConverter<K,V>
extends SequenceConverter<Map<K,V>>
    This class provides Converter implementation for all JDK java.util.Map types.

    All odd elements returned from tokenizer are map keys, all even elements are map values.

    Author:
    Fox Mulder
    See Also:
    Tokenizer, ConverterFactory.forMap(Class, Converter, Converter), ConverterFactory.forMap(Class, Converter, Converter, String), ConverterFactory.forMap(Class, Converter, Converter, Tokenizer)

      • tokenize

        protected <T> String[] tokenize(String value,
                                ValidationContext<T> context)
        Returns array of tokens extracted from the source string. All odd elements returned are map keys, all even elements are map values.
        Overrides:
        tokenize in class SequenceConverter<Map<K,V>>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - Source string to be tokenized.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Array of tokens extracted from the source string.
        Throws:
        MalformedValueException - if conversion fails.
        See Also:
